intro: Gagea stenopetala f. grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered gagea, is a flowering plant species belonging to the Amaryllidaceae family. It is characterized by its grass-like leaves and clusters of small, white to pale blue flowers. The plant is native to regions of southern Africa, particularly in the Western Cape province of South Africa. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely distributed outside its native range.
